dict.key:
When you go online, your computer gets an IP address. This is a number, by which others see you.
Find your IP address! Type: sudo ifconfig
Find on the left side "wlan0" Now look at the line next to it that says inet addr: and some numbers. For example, inet addr: 192.64.10.3

Want to see how your data travels?
ping pbskids.org
You will see lines appearing on your screen. For example: 64 bytes from 52.85.83.132: icmp_seq=1 ttl=246 time=44.652 ms
You can see the IP address of PBS Kids computer. It is 52.85.83.132
You can tell that their site is working, even without looking at your web browser.
Keep Cntrl pressed and then press C. This stops the lines.
You will see a line: 3 packets transmitted, 3 packets received, 0.0% packet loss
This tells you that all the packets got through ok and nothing was lost.
See exact way that data travels

If you want to see exactly how data travels from your computer to some site, type:
traceroute SITE_NAME Let's do traceroute pbskids.org
Now you see each step numbered 1, 2, 3, and so on.
You can see what company owns the part of the way that your data travels.
Remember, you can always stop by: Keep Cntrl pressed and then press C. This stops the lines.

Type: nmap NAME_OF_SITE
This will show you more information about that site. Look at ports. If there are many of these open, hackers can enter the system through these ports.
